page.title: 18Farming in Priors Marston
page.content: {Stirch Farm.}500 acres. Rented farm. Soil clay, ironstone. 120 dairy cows, all calves kept on for dairy or beef. Winter wheat. Run by 7 family members. International tractors & combine. {Hill Farm, Byfield Rd.}100 acres. Small family farm. Very wet lias clay. All grass. Dairying. Calves sold off. Small flock of sheep. {Blackdown Farm.}100 acres. Ironstone. Rape, wheat, potatoes. Massey ferguson combine & tractors. {Bromtrees Farm.}120 acres. 2 men. Highest in area at 600 ft. 40 acres cereal; beef cattle; small flock sheep Lower soil ironstone, higher pure sand {Cherwell Farm.}375 acres. Managers. Arable. John Deere machinery. 2 men. Lower land reclaimed open quarry. {Hill Farm, Priors Marston.}40 acres. Pre-war tractors & work by hand. 1 man Barley, wheat, hay for others' horses.
